revised_title: Infra-Red Ray Transmission and Radiant Energy Transmission in Eye Media
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the transmission of infra-red rays and radiant energy through the eye's media, including the lens, aqueous humor, and vitreous humor. They used a special condenser system and a thermopile to measure the energy falling on the eye structures. The results showed that the absorption bands of the eye media were similar to those of water, indicating that no considerable difference exists between the absorption bands of the eye media and those of water.
